means: 领…到教堂接受宗教仪式

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均可表示"教堂"之意。
means: church ： 普通用词，指顶礼膜拜上帝之地，也是西方人举行婚、丧等活动的场所。
cathedral ： 指一个教区内最大的教堂，即主教堂或总教堂，通常是装饰精良，宏伟肃穆。

sentence.Network_en: He was confirmed as a member of the Church of England.
sentence.Network_cn: 他领受了坚振礼，成为英国国教会的一员。

sentence.Network_en: The building he was lodged in turned out to be a church.
sentence.Network_cn: 原来，他租住的那栋建筑是一座教堂。

sentence.Network_en: He maintained an ambivalent attitude to the Church throughout his long life.
sentence.Network_cn: 在他漫长的一生中，他对基督教信仰始终是一种摇摆不定的态度。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cir(i)ce, cyr(i)ce, related to Dutch kerk and German Kirche, based on medieval Greek kurikon, from Greek kuriakon (dōma) 'Lord's (house'), from kurios 'master or lord'. Compare with kirk

encyclopedia.content: Church的原义 Church [tʃə:tʃ] n. 礼拜仪式， 教堂， 基督教徒 adj. 教堂的 v. 把 ... 带到教堂接受某种宗教仪式 Church的派生 Church 的派生义：面对困难永不服输。（起源于广州市第六中学 2011届高二12班） 来源：高二12班的同学们热爱生活，开朗活泼，聪明伶俐，健康快乐，以“磨砺剑，铸辉煌”为班级宣言，积极进取。他们把“Church！”作为相互激励的口号，取其上述意义的第三条，“把。..带到教

entry.def: A church is a building in which Christians worship. You usually refer to this place as church when you are talking about the time that people spend there.

example.tran: 英国最古老的教堂之一

entry.def: A Church is one of the groups of people within the Christian religion, for example Catholics or Methodists, that have their own beliefs, clergy, and forms of worship.

example.ex: Church leaders said he was welcome to return.
example.tran: 教会领袖说欢迎他回来。

entry.tran: 广纳众议的机构（或团体）；兼收并蓄的活动
entry.def: You can refer to an organization, group, or area of activity as a broad church when it includes a wide range of opinions, beliefs, or styles.

example.ex: The party has responded by trying to become a broad church that appeals to devout pensioners, Munich punks and aerospace engineers...
example.tran: 该党的反应是要努力成为一个吸引笃信宗教的退休者、慕尼黑朋客族和航天工程师的兼收并蓄的政党。

example.ex: It rapidly became apparent that rock'n'roll was a very broad church indeed.
example.tran: 摇滚乐实际无所不包，这一点很快就显而易见了。

means.word_mean: 1. one of the groups of Christians who have their own beliefs and forms of worship
2. a place for public (especially Christian) worship;
3. a service conducted in a church;
4. the body of people who attend or belong to a particular local church;

sentences.sentence: "our church is hosting a picnic next week"

means.word_mean: 1. perform a special church rite or service for;

auth_sentence.content: Above the church a vulture specked the blue sky.

At first their church helped out, but you can't keep that up forever," Andrea says.

sentences.en: There are three churches in this town.
He was the pillar of the church.

jushi.english: Commercial buildings are now beginning to dwarf the city churches.
jushi.chinese: 一幢幢商业大楼开始使城里的教堂显得矮小。

jushi.english: Which Church do you belong to?
The old man has one son in the medical profession and another in the church.
jushi.chinese: 那位老人有一个儿子在医务界,另一个儿子在宗教界。
